messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node?
The purpose of the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node is to return the generation time of the KSampler, which can be useful for benchmarking or debugging.
How is the generation time calculated in ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer?
The generation time in ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer is calculated based on the time for the entire batch.
How can the user install the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node?
To install the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node, the user needs to clone the project into the 'custom_nodes' directory of their ComfyUI install directory and then (re)start ComfyUI.
What are the outputs of the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node?

The ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node adds two outputs to the KSampler: GENERATION_TIME_STRING and GENERATION_TIME. GENERATION_TIME_STRING provides the time in seconds as a float string with 2 numbers after the comma, while GENERATION_TIME gives the time in seconds as a float.
What is the expected behavior of the generation time provided by ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer?
The generation time provided by ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer is for the whole batch. Users may need to divide this generation time by the batch size to get the average generation time.
What are some examples of how to use the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node?
Examples of how to use the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node can be found in the 'workflows' subdirectory.
What is the license of the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node?
The license of the ComfyUI_KSamplerTimer custom node is MIT.
